intro: Uranthera hostmannii, commonly known as the Hostmann's uranthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
